title.rendered: Minecraft for kids – is the game suitable?  – LOOK AT!

content.rendered:
Tips for Parents

It is important that children do not lose sight of the usage time, which can easily happen in this limitless game. Projects such as the new moat can quickly become an hour-eater. The situation is similar with the eponymous occupation of digging tunnels and building gigantic mine networks to find materials. How much time players invest is up to them, so you can play Minecraft for half an hour in between.

Younger children in particular need the support of experienced players at the beginning. There is no in-game tutorial explaining basic mechanics. Parents can step in here and join the game with the child.

The creative and adventure modes are suitable for younger children. Here the game world can be explored in peace without players having to flee from attacks. For older kids, Survival and Hardcore modes can get a little more exciting.
